intro: Lastrea eburnea, commonly known as the white-flowered lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its drought tolerance, it is well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments.
